liveChat.title: LIVE CHAT
liveChat.verifyEmail: Confirm your email address to be able to chat

limits.fiveMessagesPerMinute: You can send only 5 messages per minutes

paragraphs.1: GDPR and The Right to be Forgotten. How can I view or delete my account data?

2.first: You can view all the account data that Landover stores by signing in on the app or website (
2.second: ), and going to your profile and edit info pages.

paragraphs.3: This data consists of personal info that you entered on your settings page, for example, your user IDs, username, and email, as well as mobile device info (stored so we can send notifications to your device), about info, location country and hometown that you voluntarily provided.
paragraphs.4: If you wish to completely delete your account and all data, you can choose to delete your account on the edit info / settings page.
paragraphs.5: Please be aware that deleting your account in this way will permanently remove your data, except for the data that we need to keep to exercise our legal rights or to comply with a legal obligation. For example, if you have been banned from Landover, we keep the minimum necessary information to make sure we enforce our policies and prevent future violations.
paragraphs.6: Please also note that this will not delete your game records, your comments or other public posts.
paragraphs.7: This can not be undone, even by staff, so please think carefully before deleting your account in this way.

8.first: ***If you have lost access to your account, or have any questions about this process, please write to
8.second: and we will be happy to help.

masterMerchant.title: Master Merchant
masterMerchant.description: Pick any player with more victory points, see their hand and pick two resource or commodity cards.
masterMerchant.cannotPlay: There are no players that have more victory points than you

merchant.title: Merchant
merchant.description: Move the merchant token to your own settlement or city. The player that possesses the merchant may trade that resource 2:1 with the bank. Worth 1 VP.

dialog.title: Place Merchant
dialog.message: Are you sure you want to place a merchant here?

merchantFleet.title: Merchant Fleet
merchantFleet.description: Pick one resource or commodity of your choice to trade with the bank at a 2:1 rate for this turn only.

resourceMonopoly.title: Resource Monopoly
resourceMonopoly.description: Pick a resource. Each player must give you (up to) two of those resources if they have it.

commodityMonopoly.title: Commodity Monopoly
commodityMonopoly.description: Pick a commodity. Each player must give you one of that commodity if they have it.

expedition.title: Expedition
expedition.description: Choose any tile on the board and convert it to a gold resource tile.

dialog.title: Are you sure
dialog.message: Do you want to turn this tile into gold?

famine.title: Famine
famine.description: All players with more VPs than you discard 2 random resources.
famine.cannotPlay: There are no players with more victory points than you.

plenty.title: Plenty
plenty.description: Get two resources of your choice.

excavation.title: Excavation
excavation.description: Receive 2 clay per settlement on each clay tile

forestry.title: Forestry
forestry.description: Receive 2 wood per settlement on each wood tile

irrigation.title: Irrigation
irrigation.description: Receive 2 wheat per settlement on each wheat tile

mining.title: Mining
mining.description: Receive 2 ore per settlement on each ore tile

borderCollie.title: Border Collie
borderCollie.description: Receive 2 sheep per settlement on each sheep tile

inventor.title: Inventor
inventor.description: Swap two number tiles on the board. Swappable numbers are: 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, and 11.

dialog.title: Swap Tiles
dialog.message: Do you want swap the values of these two tiles?

medicine.title: Medicine
medicine.description: Build a city for 2 ore and 1 wheat.
medicine.cannotAfford: You need to have at least two ore and one wheat to use this card
medicine.cannotPlace: There is no where on the board to place a city

roadBuilding.title: Road Building
roadBuilding.description: Place two roads or two bridges, or one of each, at no cost to you.

military.title: Military
military.description: Upgrade your military power by one level.
military.cannotPlay: You are already have the maximum military power.

crane.title: Crane
crane.description: After playing this card, your next culture improvement this turn costs one fewer commodity
crane.cannotPlay: You cannot play this card because you have no cities or you have a Crane Card already in play.

siege.title: Siege
siege.description: Carry out a raid but steal one random resource from every player who has a village or city on the raided tile. Does not cost a military point

bishop.title: Bishop
bishop.description: Remove a catapult from the board.
bishop.cannotPlay: There are no catapults on the board for you to remove.

deserter.title: Deserter
deserter.description: Steal one level of military power from a player of your choice.
deserter.cannotPlayMaxedPower: Your military has reached its max power of 3. Upgrade your politics to level 3 to increase your max.
deserter.cannotPlayBarracks: You already have max military power.
deserter.cannotPlayEmpty: No one has any military power; there is nothing to steal

vandal.title: Vandal
vandal.description: Remove another player's road or bridge of your choosing.

diplomat.title: Diplomat
diplomat.description: Move one of your own roads or bridges to a new location.
diplomat.cannotPlay: You have no trails to move.

raze.title: Raze
raze.description: Lose 1 military power and destroy a non walled city of any player with more VPs than you. You must have military power greater than or equal to 1 to play this card.
raze.cannotPlayNoPlayers: There are no players with more victory points than you
raze.cannotPlayNoBuildings: There are no buildings to destroy
raze.cannotPlayNoMilitary: You must have at least one military power to use this card

dialog.title: Are you sure?
dialog.message: Do you want to destroy this city?

spy.title: Spy
spy.description: Pick a player, see their dev cards and choose one to steal.
spy.cannotPlay: No other player currently has development cards.

wedding.title: Wedding
wedding.description: Steal two random cards (resources or commodities) from every player that has more victory points than you.
wedding.cannotPlay: There are no players with more victory points than you.

anarchy.title: Anarchy
anarchy.description: Randomize all the number tiles on the board until a 7 is rolled.

alchemist.title: Alchemist
alchemist.description: Each turn you possess this card, you have the option of choosing the exact numbers on both 6-sided dice or doing a normal random roll.
alchemist.cannotPlay: This development card is only playable at the beginning of the turn.

traitor.title: Traitor
traitor.description: Advance the barbarian 2 spots. Will stop just before an attack.

constitution.title: Constitution
constitution.description: 1 Victory Point. Played immediately and does not count towards your max 5 dev cards.

printer.title: Printer
printer.description: 1 Victory Point. Played immediately and does not count towards your max 5 dev cards.

learningMode.title: Welcome to Landover!
learningMode.description: In this tutorial we're going to get you acquainted with the <bold>interface</bold> and the <bold>flow of the game</bold>. However, the more games you play, the better you will start to understand the strategies.

firstVillage.title: First Village
firstVillage.description: Place your village on a high value corner below. They are indicated in red. Try to get one that has 3 different types of resources. It's always good to start with wheat, clay, wood, or sheep.

firstRoad.title: First Road
firstRoad.description: Now place a road from your village towards another good corner.

firstCity.title: First City
firstCity.description: Place your city on another high value corner below. Whatever resources you didn't get with your village, try and get those with your city. Remember cities and villages must always be separated by at least one empty corner.

secondRoad.title: Second Road
secondRoad.description: And again place a road from your city towards another good corner.

rollTime.title: Time to Roll
rollTime.description: 'Now that you have placed your initial settlements, it's time to roll the dice and start collecting resources. Keep rolling until you have enough resources to build some more stuff.

moreRoads.title: Build more Roads
moreRoads.description: It looks like you have enough resources to build more roads. Go ahead and build more roads further from your settlements.

anotherVillage.title: Build another Village
anotherVillage.description: 'You now have enough resources to build a village and there is an open spot waiting for you. Go ahead and build another village to expand your empire and collect more resources each turn.

productionChart.title: Production Chart
productionChart.description: Below is how many resources villages and cities produce:

trading.title: Trading
trading.description: The Landover bank allows you to trade any resource or commodity 3 for 1. It looks like you can upgrade your village to a city but it requires a trade. Go ahead and try building a city and you should see the Trade to Build prompt. If you want more economical trades, try building a village on a harbor which gives you a 2 for 1 ability.

culture.title: Culture
culture.description: Now that you have a commodity, go ahead and open up the culture modal and upgrade. Upgrading culture will give you the potential of earning valuable dev cards, unlocking new abilities, or eventually earning metros which are worth additional VPs.

cities.title: Cities
cities.description: Go ahead and choose a village you'd like to upgrade to a city. It costs 3 ore and 2 wheat but will double the production of your village!

military.title: Military
military.description: Now that your economy is moving along, it's time to build some military to ward off barbarian attacks. You need one military power for each city when barbarians attack to avoid losing a city. The barbarian tracker is top right and shows how many rolls until they attack. Go ahead…

barbarians.title: Barbarians
barbarians.description: Barbarians are on their way. The shield top right shows if you are safe or not. If it's red, you need more military. If it's green, then you are safe. Each time they attack you'll lose 1 military power so be sure to keep adding more military over time.

metros.title: Metros
metros.description: Be sure to keep upgrading your culture with your commodity cards. Once you reach level 4 you'll receive a metro worth +2VP. Metros are immune from barbarian attacks and can't be razed by other players.

spendResources.title: Spend Your Resources
spendResources.description: You currently are at risk of discarding half your cards if a 7 is rolled! Be sure to spend your resources or build city walls to increase your hand size. City walls cost 2 clay and can be built on any cities.

goodLuck.title: Good Luck!
goodLuck.description: It looks like you are well on your way to 15 VPs. Keep expanding, building villages, upgrading to cities, leveling up your military, and building metros. If you have questions, join us on discord. Try some games against the bots, and when you're ready, challenge your friends!

end.title: Congratulations
end.description: You have just reached 15 VPs and have won the game! Hopefully you had some fun along the way. We highly recommend you try a solo game against one bot.

cancel.title: Cancel Subscription
cancel.message: Sorry to see you are not happy with your subscription. Can you please take a moment to leave some feedback for us in our Discord channel first? We're always trying to improve the app!

discord.title: JOIN THE COMMUNITY!
discord.msg2: Want to meet other Landover players, find games, learn about new features and talk directly with our dev team?

showcase.tile1: The game board is made up of hexagon <bold>tiles</bold>, each one with a <bold>resource</bold> and number.
showcase.tile2: Each turn a player rolls the <bold>dice</bold> and if that number is rolled, anyone with a settlement on that tile will collect the <bold>resource</bold> of that tile. The dice rolled are <bold>2 6-sided dice</bold>, so the best numbers are 6 and 8, then 5 and 9.
showcase.cornerValues1: See those numbers on the <bold>corners</bold> of each <bold>tile</bold>?
showcase.cornerValues2: They are there only during placement to help you easily locate <bold>high value corners</bold>, ones that are adjacent to good tiles! The highest the corner value, the better it is!
showcase.resources2:
They can be used to build different structures like <bold>roads, villages and cities</bold>.
Any time you can build, Landover will suggest those options to you on the map.
showcase.military1:
This is your <bold>military level</bold>, it's currently 0.
You can level up your military by spending <bold>1 Wheat</bold> and <bold>1 Sheep</bold>.
showcase.military2: Military defends against <bold>barbarian attacks</bold> and can be used to <bold>raid</bold> other players.
showcase.barbarians1: This is the barbarian tracker. Each time a <bold>barbarian (skull)</bold> is rolled on the <bold>dice</bold>, the barbarians move one step closer to attacking.
showcase.barbarians2: You'll need to level up your military to avoid <bold>losing a city</bold>.
showcase.culture1: These 3 circles represent your culture levels for <bold>Science</bold> (green), <bold>Commerce</bold> (yellow), and <bold>Politics</bold> (blue).
showcase.culture2: Leveling up your culture will give you <bold>development cards</bold>. Getting to level 3 unlocks a <bold>special ability</bold>. And get to level 4 first to earn a metro worth <bold>2 VPs</bold>.
showcase.playerBars1:
These are the player bars.
They show an overview of every players cards and levels.
showcase.playerBars2: The top row from left to right is: <bold>Number of ports</bold> (players with 3 or more ports can claim Port Authority for <bold>2 VPs</bold>), <bold>longest route length</bold> (players with the longest route get <bold>2 VPs</bold>), and <bold>Victory Points</bold>.
showcase.playerBars3:
The next row shows number of <bold>resource/commodity cards</bold>, number of <bold>dev cards</bold>, followed by their <bold>military</bold> and <bold>culture</bold> levels.
You can tap on a player tile to see more info!
showcase.victoryPoints: The objective of Landover is to achieve Victory Points by building settlements and expanding your empire.
